SEARCH
Package com.example

Class Game

java.lang.Object
com.example.Game
public class Game extends Object
Core engine class managing the logic and flow of a Go game session. Handles turn synchronization, move processing, and communication between players.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(int size)
    Creates a new game session with a board of the specified size.

    Method
    Description

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int size)
      Creates a new game session with a board of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the board.

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(ClientHandler player)
      Assigns players to the game session (first Black, then White).
      Parameters:
      player - The ClientHandler representing a connected player.

    • processMove

      public void processMove(int x, int y, StoneColor playerColor)
      Processes a move attempt by a player. Handles regular moves or dead stone removal if the game is over.
      Parameters:
      x - The X-coordinate of the move.
      y - The Y-coordinate of the move.
      playerColor - The color of the player attempting the action.

    • processPass

      public void processPass(StoneColor playerColor)
      Processes a "Pass" action. Ends the game if two players pass consecutively. * @param playerColor The color of the player passing their turn.

    • processSurrender

      public void processSurrender(StoneColor playerColor)
      Processes a player's surrender and declares the opponent as the winner. * @param playerColor The color of the player who surrendered.

    • processResume

      public void processResume(StoneColor playerColor)
      Resumes the game from a finished state (dispute mode for dead stones). * @param playerColor The color of the player requesting the resume.
